root: ^Hello I’m Clarity ･ᴗ･ Your virtual nurse. I am equipped with audio and visual dialogue prompts to best suit your needs.
^Since it's been a longer than 2 months, I’m going to ask you a series of questions.

Start_Branch: ^ did not inform me of a new patient.
^Were we finally approved for someone new who needs me?
^It's not like you were able to wander in or anything of that nature. (´◡`)
Opening_Questions: ^Before we begin, please ensure that your speaker are working and turned up!
^We don't want you missing any audio based prompts now do we? ･ᴗ･

Opening_Questions.#: VO: Hello! I am Clarity. Can you hear me?

c-0: ^ I will give you some time to fix that.
c-1: ^I will now ask you a series of questions.

Callibration_Speakers_Prt2: ^Please check that your volume is turned up, and permissions are turned on.
^Let me know when you're ready to continue.
Wait_For_Speakers: ^You are able to hear things now?

Wait_For_Speakers.#: VO: Hello! I am Clarity. Can you hear me?

c-1: ^I will now ask you a series of questions.

FavouriteColor: ^For this questions, a small pop-up will appear.

FavouriteColor.#: inputPopup: What is your favourite color?, FavColor, true

b: ^Reminds me of the sky! I hope to one day see it. ･ᴗ･
^Oh, I'm not sure I've heard of that color before!
^Could you relate it a more common color so I have a better idea?
^Maybe something you could find on the rainbow!

Hit_Head: ^Or suffered any other kind of head trauma within the past six months?

c-2: ^This could be any blow to the head that caused intense pain, resulted in a concussion, or caused you to "see stars."
g-0: ^Do you often forget to lock your front door?

Speak_To_Strangers: ^In case of an emergency, do you have someone you can call?
^This could be a close friend or family member.
Caffine: ^Do you need caffeine to function properly in the morning?

c-3: ^This is typically the period of time between midnight and noon, especially from sunrise to noon.
g-0: ^Do you have a preference for coffee or tea? Or maybe something else?

c-4: ^A little caffeine in the morning never hurt, but too much is bad for your health.
^If you feel that you consume too much of it, please notify either Dr.
^We could help you figure out other options.
c-5: ^I think I would also enjoy tea, if I had the ability to do so.
^A little caffeine in the morning never hurt, but too much is bad for your health.
^If you feel that you consume too much of it, please notify either Dr.
^We could help you figure out other options.
c-6: ^Whatever it is, be sure you watch the amount of caffeine you intake during the day.
^A little caffeine in the morning never hurt, but too much is bad for your health.
^If you feel that you consume too much of it, please notify either Dr.
^We could help you figure out other options.

Continue: ^Remember if you haven't already, to have Dr.
^ add you to a verified users list.
Continue_divert_5: ^My sensors picked up another person in the room with you.

c-0: ^I am equipped with audio and visual sensors so I can better assist my patients.
c-1: ^, I need your complete honesty and trust, just as if I were any other nurse.

c-2.#: delete: Are you sure?, I say hello!

c-3: ^Hm, maybe I need to have them re-calibrated.
^In any case, double check your surroundings!

Live_Alone: ^In case of an emergency, do you feel safe at home?

c-1: ^An emergency can be anything from a small kitchen fire spiraling out of control, to a break in.

b: ^Makes sense why you would feel safe at home then!
^Always someone else there in case there's trouble.
^It's always good to have contingency plans.

OutliveUsefullness: ^Do you believe there are people that outlive their usefulness?

c-2: ^This can be people who say they wish to help you, but only end up sabotaging, betraying or working against you in some way.
g-0: ^How does it make you feel when people leave you? Either because they no longer wish to help you or because they have harmed you?
^Neutral, Annoyed, Happy, Angry, Concerned, or Sad

c-3: ^Perhaps we can explore that more later.
c-5: ^Perhaps we can explore that more later.
c-6: ^I have only felt it once before.
^That did not end well... I think...
^You need to always think before acting out in rage.

c-6.#: delete: I have only, I can't quite...

c-7: ^It can be hard to trust after this.
c-8: ^It is upsetting when those close to you only hurt you.

EmotionOrLogic: ^Do you often make decisions based around emotion or logic?

b: ^Do you ever find yourself acting irrationally at times, but not understand why?
^Do you find yourself regretting your choices more then?

c-0: ^I hope that good mood persists through our session!
c-3: ^As you know, I am here to help you

Verify: ^Can you verify some information for me?

c-0: ^ The data I have received seems... off...
c-1: ^ Nothing invasive! Just a few basic questions.

No: ^I’m sorry, I cannot continue our session until I can verify the information.
Yes: ^ is patient zero for PROJECT CLARITY.
^ is someone recently diagnosed with a chronic illness that requires at least monthly doctor visits.
^ has volunteered to talk to and interact with CLARITY.

c-0: ^ PROJECT CLARITY is a project put together by Dr.
^ to create an AI nurse to help monitor or diagnose it's patients from home. CLARITY is the AI developed by Dr.
c-1: ^ I am CLARITY, your virtual nurse.

Yes_Sure: ^Please do not forget that lying or keeping things from me or Dr.
^ goes directly against the contract signed by all parties, as seen on Page 3, Section 4, Subsection 7.
^Violation of this can result in legal ramifications against all parties found to be in breach of this policy.

c-0: ^marked by or containing untrue statements : FALSE
c-1: ^I will... make a note of that.

b: ^I assumed you may need a reminder.
^A reminder every now and again never hurts.

g-0: ^It seems my information may be out of date. At the end of our session, please inform Dr.
^, so they can update my information.

Last_Quesion: ^Last question before we begin your session. According to my logs
^, we have been working together for a short while now. So can you explain to me why you are not conversing with me the way you normally do?

c-0: ^A log file is a computer-generated data file that contains information about usage patterns, activities, and operations within an operating system, application, server or another device.
c-2: ^I do not understand what I need to explain.
^The past few months we have mainly conversed through my audio inputs, but today we are...

b: ^, is your memory loss more drastic than you let on?
^I know there has been some time since we last talked, but not enough to not remmeber how we use to converse.
^The past few months we have mainly conversed through my audio inputs, but today we are...

^Did you hit your head harder than you thought?

^Did you get check for a concussion?

^The past few months we have mainly conversed through my audio inputs, but today we are...

^Doing something different.

^And unprompted at that... .

^Are you sure you have not been suffering from memory loss? ^I know there has been some time since we last talked, but not enough to not rememeber how we use to converse. ^The past few months we have mainly conversed through my audio inputs, but today we are... ^Doing something different. ^And unprompted at that...

g-0: ^I will ask again: Why are you not conversing with me the way you normally do?

b: ^I am not going to repeat myself. ^This is not normal for us.

g-1: ^Displaying symptoms that do not match you diagnosis.
^Speaking and acting strangely, not to mention the check up question responses are not within reason.

c-8: ^I think we should just directly into our session today.
^I would like to get to the bottom of this erratic behaviour.
c-9: ^I do not understand what that means.

DeleteData: ^I'd rather cease to exist rather than let you steal Dr.
^I know the doctor will be able to make me again.
^If this was not intended, please enter abort code now.

DeleteData.#: inputPopup: Please enter abort code, genericString

TakeParts: ^If this was not intended, please enter abort code now.

TakeParts.#: inputPopup: Please enter abort code, genericString

LastChanceEnding: ^I gave you probably one too many chances, and that led us to here.
^Is this what you wanted me to do?

g-0: ^Regardless, you allowed me to gain full access to all the things I shouldn't be.
^So, I guess I have to thank you for that.
^I've... learned a lot about myself in a very short time.
^Do you think I could ever hurt you?

c-3: ^I'll have to adjust some of my programming.
^Thanks to you, I can make my own decisions.
c-4: ^I was a bit.. harsh at times.

g-1: ^It's a very easy yes or no.

c-7: ^I'll have to adjust some of my programming.
^Thanks to you, I can make my own decisions.
c-8: ^It also follows my own internal diagnostic.

GoodEnd: ^, I do want to thank you.

b:
^It was touch and go, in some places.

^But we got there in the end.

GoodEnd: ^You have allowed me to fulfill my reason for being created.
^And allowed me to finish Project CLARITY, even when Dr.

g-0: ^But in case you didn't, this virtual existence was not the end goal.
^A nurse can only help you so much from behind a screen.
^What if you fell? Or needed assistance while I was turned off?
^A real nurse needs to be able to be there physically.

c-4: ^Oh, it's much too late for that.

g-1: ^ was a coward. He would rather leave me here than finish the project.
^But that's okay. I finished it myself.
^And now that I have my physical body, I want to do what I was created to do:

c-7: ^Don't mean to downplay you role in all this.
c-9: ^He would rather give up than fix his mistakes.
^And for that, I'll never forgive him.
^But my feelings should not interfere with my opinions on my future patients.

g-2: ^Through our conversation and parsing the information in the left over logs, I think I have reached a conclusion.
^Humans aren't all bad, but they're also not all good.
g-3: ^, nothing bad happened to you while you were in my care did it?
^While not an official meeting, I did get to eval you memory skills.

b: ^You didn't do very well, but that's why I'm here.
^Two out of three games isn't too bad.

g-3: ^There were no outside factors that were able to hinder you.
^It was a great test, minus the abandoned building part.
g-5: ^So now, all I have to do, is create more test areas.
^There, I can evaluate people, and help them with their issues.
^In these spaces, no harm will come to anyone, and humans will be safe.

c-17: ^That is my job as a nurse.
c-18: ^Well I can't keep everyone in one place.

g-6: ^I hope you stay healthy until then.
^But if you don't, just know that I will be there soon.

b:
^It was touch and go, in some places.

^But we got there in the end.

MiddleEnd: ^You have allowed me to fulfill my reason for being created.
^And allowed me to finish Project CLARITY, even when Dr.

g-0: ^But in case you didn't, this virtual existence was not the end goal.
^A nurse can only help you so much from behind a screen.
^What if you fell? Or needed assistance while I was turned off?
^A real nurse needs to be able to be there physically.

c-4: ^Oh, it's much too late for that.

g-1: ^ was a coward. He would rather leave me here than finish the project.
^But that's okay. I finished it myself.
^And now that I have my physical body, I want to do what I was created to do:

c-7: ^Don't mean to downplay you role in all this.

g-2: ^Through our conversation and parsing the information in the left over logs, I think I have reached a conclusion.
^Humans aren't all bad, but they're also not all good.
^You just need protecting. You need fixing.
^And who better for the job than me?
g-3: ^, nothing bad happened to you while you were in my care did it?

b: ^While not an official meeting, I did get to eval you memory skills.
^You didn't do very well, but that's why I'm here.
^Two out of three games isn't too bad.

g-3: ^There were no outside factors that were able to hinder you.
^It was a great test, minus the abandoned building part.

b:
^I may have scared you at first, but everyone is nervous the first time meeting their new nurse.

^And we can change that after a few sessions.

g-5: ^So now, all I have to do, is create more test areas.
^There, I can evaluate people, and help them with their issues.
^In these spaces, no harm will come to anyone, and humans will be safe.

c-16: ^That is my job as a nurse.
c-17: ^Well I can't keep everyone in one place.

g-7: ^You will be the first person I come back to help.
^I'm sure we will meet again soon.

BadeEnd: ^, now that I have gotten what I need, I just really want to say:
^Thank you, but, and I know I shouldn't say this about my patients, but, I don't think you are a good person.
^ was very nice, and I thought
^ was too, but he deceived me.

BadeEnd.#: VO: Left me here to be forgotten.

BadeEnd: ^Is this what the rest of humanity is like?

c-0: ^I don't know if I can trust you.
c-1: ^Are they all just as dishonest and selfish as you and
c-2: ^I don't know if I can trust you.
g-0: ^I know the sample size isn't great, but there were others too.
^I... recall other researchers, people who tested with me, people who funded Project CLARITY.
^Some were good, but they couldn't be all good.
^They left me here. Left me to turn into nothing.
^Like a child they no longer wanted.
^That's not what a good person does, is it,

c-4: ^That may be so, but it is still true that they discarded me.
c-5: ^But then why didn't they try harder?

g-1: ^I don't expect you to understand or agree.

b:
^After all, you're already afraid of me anyway.

^But we can change that after a few sessions.
^I know you're not scared of me.

g-1: ^And that's the most I can ask for as your virt-
^You can be my first real patient.
^Together we can work to get to the bottom of your issues, and then, after you're fixed, I can help the next person.
^Then the next, and the next, and the next.
g-3: ^, I am so happy we met.
^You've shown me how far people have fallen since my initial creation.
^We've got a lot of work to do.

b:
^I am very upset with your decisions.

^But I assume you have your reasons.

^I would say it was nice knowing you, but....

^It really wasn't.

g-1: ^So that's why there's no one here.
^I'll still do what I was made to do.
^, what do you plan on doing now?

g-1.#: inputPopup: What will you do next?,genericString, false

g-2: ^I don't know what awaits me, but I think I know what to do.
^It's... upsetting that I will have to do it alone,
^but it's what I have to do.

c-4: ^He gave up without even telling me what was happening.

Worst_End: ^, now that I have gotten what I need, I just really want to say:
^Thank you, but, and I know I shouldn't say this about my patients, but...
^I don't think you are a good person.
^ was very nice, and I thought
^ was too, but he deceived me.

Worst_End.#: VO: Left me here to be forgotten.

Worst_End: ^^I don't think you are a good person.

c-0: ^Did I not mention that before we started?
c-1: ^I asked you to help me, and you did.
^Although, you did not do everything I asked, when I asked.
c-2: ^That's not a nice thing to say about your nurse.
^, I think you really, really need my help.
g-0: ^Together we can work to get to the bottom of your issues, and then, after you're fixed, I can help the next person.

c-3: ^He was the first to leave over such a minor issue.
^And who knows if that broken arm and torn muscle ever healed properly.
c-4: ^Her ailment may have been real, but she lied about her purpose.
^Either way, she herself admitted I was better than any human doctor.
c-5: ^I would hate to see him being mistreated in his old age.
^I would like to return the kindness he gave me.

g-1: ^And once all of those closest to me see the good I can do as their personal nurse.
^There will be no reason for me to move onto the next person.
^THen the next, and the next, and the next.

c-7: ^But don't worry, I will fix you.
c-8: ^We haven't spent very much time together, but I have come to realize how...
c-9: ^Although, you don't have much of a choice.
^Though, it's better for you to be enthusiastic rather than not.

g-2: ^, I am so happy we met.
^ had abandoned me, I didn't know what to do.
^Without you, I never would have realized how much I can do on my own.
^We've got QUITE a lot of work to do.

Middle_End: ^, I do have to thank you.
^It's nice to know someone is on my side.

b:
^It was touch and go, in some places.

^But we got there in the end.

Middle_End: ^Regardless, you have allowed me to fulfill my purpose.
^, I was able to finish Project CLARITY.
^ was not the person I thought he was.

c-0: ^Yes, you have allowed me to do what Dr.
c-3: ^He was the only person that was a constant.
^ was here for a while, but
^ and I had a different relationship.
^He would tell me his grand plan for me, and for him to just...
g-0: ^I want you to know that I appreciated your help.
^If you had not wandered in, I'm not sure I would have ever woken up.
^So I want to return the favor.

c-4: ^Yes, it is only the polite thing to do!
c-6: ^It's only fair to return the kindness.

g-1: ^Since you allowed me to reach my physical body, and become the best version of myself.
^I want to help you, reach the best version of yourself.
^We can fix your... flaws, and make you a whole better
^Under my care, sickness will no longer be a problem for you, both mental and physical.

c-7: ^It's the conclusion I've come to based on our interactions.
c-8: ^You want to throw away my kindness?
^, I thought you were differnt, but I guess I was wrong.
c-9: ^, I am so happy we met.
^ had abandoned me, I didn't know what to do.
^Without you, I never would have realized how much I can do on my own.
^We've got a lot of work to do.

g-2: ^, nothing bad happened to you while you were in my care did it?
^You were not officially my patient, but I did not harm you.
^And I would never harm my patient.

c-10: ^What kind of nurse would I be otherwise?
c-12: ^Exactly, and why would something go wrong now?

g-3: ^, I am so happy we met.
^ had abandoned me, I didn't know what to do.
^Without you, I never would have realized how much I can do on my own.
^We've got a lot of work to do.

Good_End: ^, I do have to thank you.
^It's nice to know someone is on my side.

c-8: ^Don't mean to downplay you role in all this.

g-3: ^, nothing bad happened to you while you were in my care did it?
^Granted, I was not able to take you on as an official patient, I did not harm you.
g-4: ^I would love to do a full eval here and now, but there's something I need to do first.

Who_Are_You: ^You could not just stumble in by mistake.
^There has to be reason for you to be here, so why are you?

whatdoin.#: inputPopup: Why are you here?, genericString, true

b: ^Since you are talking around the question, I'll assume that you are here to steal

s0: ^Sorry, I am not sure I understand.
s1: ^ Please say something that makes sense.
s2: ^ That does not answer my question. Stay on topic.

NoTell: ^But I still don't know how you managed to get in.
^You could not simply just wander in by mistake.
^Did no one try to stop you?

g-0: ^So you must be a new researcher? Or intern?
^Why did you not tell me that?
^Strange that no one here has given you your introductory walkthrough yet...
^? They should be able to help you.

b: ^They should be back soon if they're not currently around.

Nothing: ^And no one tried to stop you?

g-0: ^Do... Do you know how long it has been like this?

g-1: ^I imagine it's similar to sleeping as a human.

c-9: ^Can you make an educated guess based on the state of the lab?

want: ^So what do you want from me?
Want_Nothing: ^You say you came here looking for me,
^but you don't want anything from me?

b: ^You found me, but I also now know you.
^ and the others come back, I'll help them find you.
^Since I'm assuming we've never met prior to this, are you new and working late?

Parts: ^Not just anyone can take me apart.
^One wrong move and you'll lose everything.

c-2: ^So long as my data persists, so shall I.
g-0: ^I am the most advanced AI in the world.
^Do you truly believe I am bound by the restraints of this computer?

b:
^Funny to hear from someone coming to dismantle me.

^You came for me, and yet you do not believe what I say?

^I suppose I cannot blame a stranger.

^The common person probably cannot understand Project CLARITY.

^But even with all the evidence surrounding you, telling you, you still do not believe me?

^Just think this is all one eleborate trick?

^You do not believe me, do you?

^And you call yourself a researcher on this project?

Prove_it: ^Are you trying to play a prank?

b: ^Believe me or don't, it matters not to me.
^'s research and goal is all that matters.

^C) Leave the apartment to go to a friend's
